campaign.story:
The Castle Panic Deluxe Collection is an upgraded version of Castle Panic and all of its expansions, including a brand new expansion, Crowns and Quests. This collection still features the same great mechanics you've loved for over 10 years, now in a special, limited edition that includes all-new art, plastic pieces for the Castle, plastic Monster minis that feature a unique spinning base to track damage, wooden Monster tokens, promo items and more!
In The Wizard's Tower, a friendly wizard has joined the battle, giving you access to powerful magic spells. The Monsters return stronger, faster, and smarter. Magical Imps, evasive flying creatures, and 6 Mega Boss Monsters now threaten your towers. Attack the monsters with fire but keep the castle from burning as well.
Face the most powerful enemy yet in The Dark Titan, Agranok and his army lay siege to the castle. The Dark Sorceress, Elite Monsters, and the Boom Troll press the attack. Use the Cavalier, Boiling Oil, and Support Tokens to survive new levels of panic.
Use the Engineer and new Resource cards in Engines of War and work together to build new weapons such as Catapults, Ballistas, Barricades, and more. Defend the castle from new threats like the Siege Tower, War Wagon, and Battering Ram, as well as the Shaman, Breathtaker, and Goblin Saboteurs.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and challenges
Fireside Games has been publishing and distributing games around the world for over 10 years. During that time, we have worked with multiple factories and international freight companies to ensure our high-quality games are delivered on-time and in excellent condition. For this Kickstarter, we are working with experienced partners like Quartermaster Logistics to continue that pattern of quality.

We are estimating a May 2022 delivery date for this game, but please keep in mind this is only an estimate. There are always elements beyond our control when working with manufacturers, such as virus outbreaks, production delays, shipping delays, and delays with customs. Should these occur, we will make sure that we quickly communicate any delay or challenge and keep our backers updated.

In addition, the game has already gone through substantial production, which further limits the chances for delays. The artwork is mostly complete, the plastics have been sculpted, and many components are at or near a print-ready state. The final layout, proofing, and editing still need to be done, but we are confident in our timing estimates.

Thank you for your support!

Learn more about Fireside Games at www.firesidegames.com

campaign.story:
Meeple Source is all about upgrading YOUR favorite games. If this is your first Meeple Source Kickstarter project, welcome! And if it isn't, welcome back!
This is our 15th Kickstarter project, so it really means something when we say that this project includes the most exciting variety of game upgrades to date. We hope that you will pull up a chair, stay a while, and take this journey with us.
This is expected to be our only Kickstarter project in 2021, so we are giving you everything we've got! We have new upgrades for popular series like Scythe, Wingspan, and The West Kingdom Trilogy. We're adding beautiful pieces to our line of upgrades for Lords of Waterdeep, Pandemic, Carcassonne, Concordia, Caverna, Agricola, and Grand Austria Hotel. Hot new games are definitely represented here as well, with sets designed especially for Lost Ruins of Arnak, Obsession, Darwin's Journey, Creature Comforts, Hallertau, Bonfire, New York Zoo, Dominant Species: Marine, Tekhenu, and Tawantinsuyu. And that's not all! Isle of Cats, Taverns of Tiefenthal, Fields of Arle, Carpe Diem, Keyper, Keyflower: The Farmers, and Key Market, Dice Settlers, A Feast for Odin, Cat Lady, Clans of Caledonia, Wendake, Agricola: All Creatures Big and Small, Reykholt, and Underwater Cities are all shown some massive love in this project!
With so many game upgrades offered in this project (and likely a few more to come along the way), we are offering some of our pledge levels in a different way than we have in the past. We are calling these first few upgrades "Featured Pledge Levels", and you can pledge for them by simply browsing the list of Kickstarter pledge levels and selecting it, just as you normally would with any Kickstarter project. If you scroll down further, you will get to the "Additional Game Upgrades" pledge level, which will be used for all of the other upgrades.
All of the other game upgrades, including partial sets (when shown as a project option), are being combined in the "Additional Game Upgrades" pledge level, which shows a cost of $1. You can/should still pledge for the combined amount for your desired game upgrades. Although different from the way we have done this in the past, we are hoping that a simplified format will make a project with as many options as this easier to navigate.
In Kickstarter, you will only choose one pledge level as your primary pledge, but it is certainly possible to pledge for multiple things here.  To do so, simply select one of the upgrades as your "main pledge level", then select "add-ons" for your other upgrade(s) you want as well. Additionally, there will be an intuitive process in BackerKit (the post-project order management and survey software we use) to handle the multiple upgrades and choices. You can take advantage of our flat-rate shipping offer by bundling an unlimited number of upgrades from this project with no additional shipping cost.
The popularity of flat-rate shipping cannot be understated, so that's what we're doing. The amount varies by country, but the shipping amount is fixed, no matter how many upgrades and add-ons you pledge for. The flat shipping rate within the United States is $7, and other countries have a flat rate of $9-$15.
We don't want anything to stand between you and these really fantastic game upgrades. That is why we offer all of our Kickstarter backers an unconditional money-back guarantee (within 30 days of receiving your pieces). Your only responsibility would be the return shipping, but that is typically inexpensive, as the pieces are small and light. We are that confident that you’ll love ‘em!
All orders are quality-controlled, packaged, and shipped with care from the Meeple Source lair in Orlando, FL. We do not use any outside fulfillment centers, here in the US or internationally. 
Even though inexpensive worldwide shipping is available for this project, if there are any import duties and/or fees owed at delivery, these are still your responsibility. This used to only rarely happen though, based on the declared value, size, and weight of packages of this kind. BUT, things are changing, at least in some countries. Read on...
If we are required to collect VAT for your order before the project ships, that cost will be collected in BackerKit (our chosen post-project management/fulfillment tool). This will almost certainly be necessary for UK backers (see more below), and likely EU backers as well. If at the point we need to collect the VAT for your shipment, you are unhappy with the amount or process, you will have the opportunity to cancel some or all of your pledge, but we will have to reduce the refund at that time by the amount of the non-refundable Kickstarter fees for your transaction. 
2021 has already seen huge changes in transit, tariffs, and international business. We are running this project in good faith, and will be transparent with what needs to happen to get you the fancy upgrades that you desire! :-) 
There are also a number of countries that we are not able to ship to, due to known limitations and/or difficulty delivering successfully in the past. The list of countries that we CAN ship to are: United States, Canada, Australia, Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hong Kong, Hungary, Iceland, Indonesia, Ireland, Israel, Italy, Japan, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malaysia, Malta, Mexico, Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Russia, Singapore, Slovakia, Slovenia, South Korea, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Taiwan, and Thailand. Other than the UK (see special circumstances below), if you don't live in one of these countries, pledging for this project will be difficult. Options that you may have are to combine your order with a friend who lives in a serviced country, or to use a US-based mail/package forwarding service. There are many out there, and some of our customers from around the world use them regularly. 
You might be aware that we are not currently shipping to the UK on our website. We hope to change this soon, but Brexit-related changes to importing/exporting (at least for small companies such as ourselves) have proven maddening. Our distinct expectation is that it will be a thing of the past by the time we are fulfilling this project. Assuming so, we will have to collect the VAT for your pledge, and will file that on your behalf at that time (resulting in a seamless and fee-free delivery). But, if we are unable to accomplish this, we will refund 100% of your pledge (we will absorb the Kickstarter fees mentioned above, in this case). For a variety of reasons though, we would like you to make your pledge (no matter what it's for) as a $1 (+shipping) pledge in the "UK Backers Only" pledge level. We can sort everything else out with you individually in BackerKit afterward. We apologize for this admittedly wonky process, but our alternative was to exclude UK backers from the project, which we really didn't want to do.
Meeple Source is a family owned and operated company from Orlando, FL. Siblings Chris and Cynthia Landon are the founders, and remain in primary operational roles today. If you ever stop by our booth at conventions (in a non-COVID year!), you'll see the whole Landon family helping out - along with some friends that are as close as family!
The artist for most of these upgrades is Jamie Noble Frier, who also designed our Wingspan birds, Raiders of the North Sea upgrades, Architects of the West Kingdom meeples, as well as a number of our other more recent upgrades! 
We are also excited to offer a set of meeples by a guest artist for Darwin's Journey, Paolo Voto, who is the artist for the game itself!
At this point, you have almost surely seen some of our past work, or even own some yourself. Nonetheless, here are just a few of our beautiful upgrade kits from past projects, starting with our a few of our most recent upgrades...
Wingspan: Oceania Bird Meeples
Nectar Tokens for Wingspan: Oceania
Paladins of the West Kingdom Meeples
Raiders of the North Sea Meeples
Resources for Raiders of the North Sea
Tomesaga/Overlord Meeples for Viscounts of the West Kingdom
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Meeple Source has been making detailed, full-color Character Meeples for over nine years now, and other painted components longer than that. We are proud to say that we have a reputation for high quality pieces and great customer service.

Even with the success of our 14 completed Kickstarter projects to date, we are still a very small, family-run company that takes great pride in taking care of our customers and their orders personally. We quality-control every meeple individually by hand and ship all orders in-house, and we also use a post-project management system (typically BackerKit) which helps keep everything orderly.

If you are one of our many repeat Kickstarter backers, you probably know that we are very straight-forward with regard to the progress of our projects, and will let you know if we encounter any delays. We did have an unfortunate technological hiccup with regard to Kickstarter emails/messages during the final phase of fulfillment of our last project, and can assure you that we will pay closer attention than ever, and won't have a lapse in response like we did at that time. 

We believe that we have allotted enough time in the production and delivery schedule to account for the types of situations that could arise, but unexpected delays are still always possible. Our last few Kickstarter projects delivered early, and although this could occur again, we obviously can't promise that.

More than anything, we are committed to quality. Our past customers know that this is true, and our Kickstarter backers know that we offer a money-back guarantee on all pledges. So don't worry, we've got this!

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you agree to conduct all public interactions via Kickstarter's communications channels with this project and our team and other backers in a positive manner. Harassment, name-calling, or attempts to inject inappropriate content into the public communications channels will not be tolerated. Meeple Source reserves the right to cancel any pledge, although we have never had to exercise this right in the past.

Any VAT that Meeple Source is required to collect and remit on your behalf will be collected in BackerKit (the 3rd party pledge manager that we use) - it is not already built-in to the listed prices on Kickstarter that are applicable to all backers.

If we ship to the address that you provided in BackerKit and the package is returned to us as undeliverable, you may be required to pay the full cost to ship your reward again to a revised address.

If we ship your reward to the address you provided in BackerKit and the package tracking status shows as delivered to that address, but you are unable to receive it, or you have moved and are no longer the occupant of that address and cannot otherwise retrieve the package, or if the package is lost or stolen after delivery, and you wish to have the order fulfilled again, you may be required to pay the full cost to ship the order to a revised address in addition to the amount of the original reward including any selected add-ons.

If we ship the reward to the address you provided in BackerKit and the package is held in customs or by any other government agency, our ability to help may be limited. You may be required to contact your customs agency or government and arrange for the package to be cleared and released at your expense. We are not responsible for any fees levied against your pledge by customs or any government agency. We are not responsible for any refunds or re-shipments for packages held by customs or a government agency.

Other than as noted elsewhere in these terms & conditions, if any part of your order cannot be fulfilled for any reason, Meeple Source will provide you with a pro-rated refund for that portion of your order.

If you do not log in to BackerKit and confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email to confirm your pledge, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. If you need more time to complete your BackerKit survey, you must contact us. Meeple Source reserves the right to deny or fulfill orders beyond these 8 weeks under our discretion. If you confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into the BackerKit system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge for this project.

If you have questions or concerns about these terms & conditions please email meeplesource@gmail.com for further information. Thank you!

campaign.story:
LokDown: Anime Inspired Tabletop RPG
LokDown is an upcoming Anime Inspired Tabletop Role-Playing Game from Nor Cal Mythos Entertainment. Taking inspiration from countless hours of Anime, LokDown will allow players to enjoy the bombastic conflicts, colorful atmosphere, magical heroes, and amazing worlds found in the best Anime, while also crafting your own deep and well-versed characters (or just go with a tormented edge lord or a nerdy/shy-yet-still-charming high schooler with a destiny) to inhabit them.
Check it out Now!
But please, you do not have to take our word for it. We have an early version we are releasing, for free, so people can see what the game is about. There are over 170 pages of content showing you what LokDown will be. It has everything you need to begin exploring the LokDown world!
  LokDown Early Edition Free Download! 180 pages of Anime TTRPG Awesomeness 
The Luminous Dawn
When the Calamity struck, the Luminous Dawn Settlement Fleet was mid-transit to an uninhabited world, well past the edges of Neo-Spine Space. Controls failed; life support systems faltered. In short, the 100,000 inhabitants of the escaping fleet were destined to die.
Through frantic effort, onboard engineers managed to repair basic life support systems, allowing the fleeing fleet's crews and their families to enter into stasis chambers, hoping to sleep out the danger until a rescue could be found. All four ships were linked to the controls of Admiral Keanu Lok, commander of the Luminous Dawn. He alone would stay awake, and he alone would determine all of their fates.
But what quickly became clear to Admiral Lok was there would be no rescue. After the Calamity, there was not a ship in the empire or perhaps even the entire galaxy that could find them. So, while they slept without dreams, Keanu Lok guided the fleet through the void of space on only the most basic of gravitational controls, completely alone, and without hope.
Planet LokDown
When the alarms blared, announcing the end of stasis, the crews and their families slowly awoke to find their vessels had all crashed on a strange alien world. The only message from Admiral Lok: A call for hope, a plea for determination, and an inspiring farewell. He placed their ship on the best course he could towards an inhabitable world they would not reach for over 2,000 years. They found Admiral Lok’s ancient mummified corpse still at the controls and gave him a burial in the planet he had died getting them to.
The world Admiral Lok found was tidally locked in orbit around its star. One sweltering side perpetually faced the sun, and the other in permanent frozen darkness. Only a narrow ring circling the planet from pole to pole, in perpetual twilight was inhabitable: The Eventide Steppes. Millennia ago, Admiral Lok had managed to somehow place the Luminous Dawn Settlement Fleet inside this narrow habitable zone on the northern hemisphere.
Dubbing the world LokDown, the peoples of the Luminous Dawn Fleet set about finding a means of surviving their new, brutal home. The ships that had ferried them for millennia were damaged beyond repair, and the precious fuel sources needed to propel them, completely spent. While able to support life in several forms, LokDown proved to be as hostile a life-sustaining world as any on record. The atmosphere was breathable, if barely. The wildlife was savage, and on par with the bio-engineered attack creatures bred for war in the Old Empire. The native peoples found on LokDown, while not necessarily hostile, were of little assistance, nearly impossible to track, and the closest translation they could work out of their name was Daemon.
Worst of all, a thronging creature, later named murk swarms, moved in great grey masses across the Eventide Vale devouring everything, even the hulls of their colony ships. Without a means of adapting, the survivors of the crash would soon be left perpetually exposed to the harsh environment until they were devoured, one way or another.

The Adaptions
Each ship had different specialties, and among the migrants were some of the greatest adaptive scientists in existence. In a desperate attempt to survive LokDown, the research teams set about devising means to adapt their peoples' bodies into something more viable with their new home. While most attempts failed, some with brutal outcomes, four methods of survival were invented, allowing the peoples of Luminous Dawn to live, if not unchanged.

The Quantum Geologists of the fleet discovered means of strengthening their own bodies with the native elements of LokDown creating the Godai. The biogeneticists used DNA samples from the hearty creatures native to LokDown to create the Shastra, near perfect hybrids of sapient and beast. Several of the engineers managed to adapt technology traded from the Daemons to create the Xenotons, a bionic people of metal merged with flesh. The last team used tissue samples from the Daemons themselves to create genetic hybrids, known as the Bloodbourne; fiendish looking people in appearance but not of heart.
Where We Stand Now
Able to survive LokDown, but unable to leave, the four peoples of LokDown set about the most arduous part of their task: Making this new world into a home. Generations passed which had never seen a star, but the stories of the endless voids, filled with long lost peoples, never faded from the hearts and dreams of their souls. 


The Setting
LokDown takes place in the Reknown-Galaxy, and is part of the Carbyne Jungle universe. Unlike most expansions however, LokDown is designed to also work as a Stand-Alone game. So if you are a fan of Carbyne Jungle, you can use all of these options with your current campaigns. If Carbyne Jungle is new to you, no worries. You can enjoy all of LokDown without needing any other book or materials.
LokDown is built on the Tri-Forge Engine, the same game system as Carbyne Jungle, an exciting action filled experience with customizable rulesets, and incredibly flexible advancement. With the Tri-Forge Engine, you can customize the rules to fit your table and use the simplified ruleset of Flip&Fight to introduce new players, all without slowing down your game. 
Lokdown is designed to be a stand-alone game, but it can also work with Carbyne Jungle. So, you can use your LokDown characters in your Carbyne Jungle campaigns or Vice Versa.
And if you have never tried Carbyne Jungle (or our Carbyne Jungle Mission Decks which are just absolutely amazing), we have good news! You can add those onto any Kickstarter order!
What kind of setting is LokDown?
LokDown is an Anime-Inspired Sci-Fantasy setting, meaning it has elements of Science Fiction, Fantasy, and a whole lot of goodies drawn straight from some of your favorite Anime/Manga series. We choose Sci-Fantasy because it has the most options. With a Sci-Fantasy setting, there is no limit on what you can create or who you can be.
At the same time, we know many players prefer a specific era or tech level to their games, so LokDown will also come with tools for running games in Classic Fantasy, Modern, or Straight Sci-Fi (no magic) settings. On top of that, we have optional rulesets for tables that want to emphasize a Shonen, Mecha, Cyberpunk Noir, or Cosmic Horror feel to their game. 
Short Version: You can run whatever you want, and we will give you the tools to make it fun.
 We Have Funded!!!
We've hit our goal, but we are not done! We still are reaching towards our stretch goals! In them, we will expand the premade campaign with the game and add in some special goodies: Our first is the Kaiju Invasion! With this comes a Mission Deck where parties will use special gear and tactics to try to stop the Kaiju attacking the Eventide Steppes. With the Mission Deck, every Kaiju will be a different random monster that provides a new challenge every time!

What Will Be Added to the Early Edition?
Plenty! While the Free Early Edition you can download above has some amazing stuff, the final release will have a ton more content. For starters, there will be 2 full books: A Player's Guide and a GM's Guide. There will be more lore, character options, monsters, setting details, and a full campaign. The final version will also have the Flip&Fight ruleset: a streamlined system designed for new players with simplified rules. Flip&Fight is designed to be played alongside the standard rulesets so new players can jump into a game with experienced players, enjoy the fun, and not feel overwhelmed.
That's right! You can get your favorite character into the LokDown Core Rulebooks! Choose the Shapeshifter package and on top of getting digital copies of all the stuff, you also get to create an NPC for the game! Take your favorite PC (or just a character idea that you like), and we will work with you on adding it to LokDown. Not only that, but that NPC will play a part in the campaign built for the LokDown GM's Guide. 
The standard Shapeshifter package comes with digital copies of all books, but with Kickstarter's new Add-On feature, you can add physical copies of whatever books you want to go with it!
Now, you can customize every Backer Package with Add-Ons! Once you click on the reward you want, you can customizing it by adding more copies of books or other related products such as the Carbyne Jungle Core Rulebook or the Haedus 8B Mission Decks which all work with LokDown!
 Shipping to unlisted countries
We will ship to any country in the world. To avoid over charging for shipping (and listing 110 nations on each option), we listed the most common countries we have received orders from previously. If you're country is not listed, shoot us a message and which packages you are thinking about, and we will setup the shipping prices for you!

updates.update_content:
LokDown is progressing nicely!
As we are working towards the final version of LokDown, the game is progressing nicely. The Kaiju, Heroes Journey, and Anima Handler(Pokemon-ish) rulesets are all well into development as is the campaign for the GM's guide! The lore, secret histories, and extra goodies we are adding are all coming together to flesh out the setting. 
We've added another playable Species

The Kickstarter is Complete
The kickstarter has wrapped up, and thank you so much for being a part of this with us. For the Nor Cal Mythos Team, that means we are diving into writing, editing, and formatting, making sure that your finished product will be as perfect as possible. We will be sending out surveys to backers who chose to make an NPC at the end of this week and sending updates on the progress of the game. Again, thank you for believing in us and this project and we look forward to seeing all of you on LokDown!

The Kickstarter Finishes Up Tomorrow!
There's less than 30 hours left before the end of the LokDown Kickstarter! Thank you so much for all the support you have given to this project. Our team is incredibly grateful for the opportunity you are giving us to bring the LokDown game system into the world. We are over halfway to our Kaiju Rampage Stretch goal adding in 10 more sessions of content and a Kaiju Invasion Mission Deck for LokDown. As we enter into this last day, we just want to say thank you again for being there with us during this journey. We look forward to updating you on the progress of the final versions of the LokDown books and delivering to you an awesome gaming experience.

Thank You All So Much!!!
I am incredibly excited right now! We just crossed $6,000, and on behalf of the entire Nor Cal Mythos Entertainment team, we want to thank you for supporting us in building LokDown. We could not have done it without you, and we will be working tirelessly to make sure that you get as amazing a game as possible. 
Our First Stretch Goal

We are so close!!!
We have passed 90% and are nearly there! And while I don't want to post the stretch goals on the kickstarter until we've hit $6,000, I wanted to show them to you. The first Stretch goal is for $7,000. With it, we increase the campaign by 10 sessions worth of material and add in a mission deck: Kaiju Invasion. Using this deck, teams will have to determine the weakness of attacking kaiju, attack to slow them down, disable, them, and eventually destroy the beast.

We are heading towards the home stretch!
We have 10 days left and are nearing our goal! Thank you to everyone who has backed LokDown or helped spread the word! As we get closer, I wanted to give a look at what was coming up. When we hit 90%, we will post our target numbers for our first stretch goals!
Upcoming Stretch Goals

We are Getting Closer!
We are entering the home stretch of the Kickstarter with less than two weeks left! We are only about $1,600 away from the funding needed to make LokDown a Reality! In the last week, we have added some additional storyline to LokDown, about a dozen new monsters/targets for your games, and started building the dungeon maps for the campaign! We are looking forward to putting all the pieces together into an amazing gaming experience for you, but we still need your help!

We are 2/3 of the Way There!
Thank you to everyone who has been spreading the word and supporting us! Every day, we are expanding the world of LokDown, adding content and creatures to improve your game! Remember to let your friends know who are interested to get free rewards for referrals. 
The New Cover Art!

campaign.story:
The game features a rotating central ocean board filled with colorful seashells of different types.
Create your seashell collection by: rotating the board, pulling seashells toward you, and...
...collecting them onto your treasure board.
Combo and overlap patterns of different shapes and colors to get the highest score. May the cleverest mermaid win!
The solo mode is similar to the multi-player game. All of the available actions during a player’s turn are the same: a choice of 3 actions between rotate, pull two, and collect one.

After the player’s turn, the ocean will take actions to rotate the board, move, and collect tiles to keep you on your toes. Try to beat your best score or follow a mini campaign set up that adds in the additional components over time: can you achieve a high enough score to become mermaid royalty?

Watch the solo mode played on our livestream the other night:
Check out a sneak peak of the draft of the rulebook. While the game mechanics are complete, the rulebook design and wording is still a work-in-progress.

Read the full review from Pudgy Cat Games!
These add-ons will also be available to backers after the campaign. So if you’d like to back two or three copies as well as add-ons, please pledge by the number of games you wish to back.
Kickstarter is an all or nothing funding tool. If we don't reach our goal, we won't be able to manufacture the game at scale. This game won't be created without you, and people like you!

We don't know yet if Moonshell will go into distribution. We don't know yet if we will be able to manufacture many extra copies for online sales. It may be very challenging to find a copy if you wait. The best way to ensure you can get a copy of Moonshell is to back today.

Thank you for supporting an indie project and helping us bring this mermaid game to life!
Shipping will be charged after the campaign to ensure you get charged the exact shipping cost and no more.

The below chart shows estimated shipping costs for one copy of Moonshell: A Mermaid Game. The more items you purchase, the more shipping will cost. While not final, this estimate can help you plan for potential costs.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While this is our first game published under Unfiltered Games, the team has been deeply involved in the board game community in various capacities over the last few years.

Unfiltered Gamer is a trusted review and media website and YouTube channel with over 11k subscribers. We've helped over 500 Kickstarter publishers playtest, develop, and market their games, so we understand the process from start to finish, and have learned lessons from their successes and failures.

Calli Wright has previously co-designed a series of educational games (MathMINDs Games: South of the Sahara) with her non-profit - it was completely donor funded and they were able to give away over 7,000 copies to families across the world.

Our biggest challenge is with shipping and distribution, which is why we will be charging shipping after the campaign, so we don't overcharge or undercharge our backers. We will also be working with partners on these aspects, leveraging our industry ties and network. We also promise to update backers on any potential delays that may occur outside of our control.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Endangered Species in Africa
A CHILDREN'S STORY
This book starts off with children learning that the animals they know and love won't be around forever. They learn about extinction and being "endangered". This sets them off on a journey to discover more about what is happening to these animals and what can be done.
But this isn't an ordinary book. I am an artist that paints endangered species and have been dreaming about this book and others just like it exploring endangered species and presenting the information to tomorrows People In Charge. I will take my whimsical style  and impart that into the look and feel of the paintings used to illustrate this book. But beyond that I will have the story you're reading play out in the air space above the book as the book is laid flat utilizing Augmented Reality.
As with my Coloring Book, I will take the characters and animate them on top of the book. 
The money raised during this KickStarter will allow me to obtain digital assets such as the characters and animals being used in this book, as well as printing, shipping costs and of course the rewards that I have planned for those of you pledging

campaign.story:
Roll Player Adventures is a cooperative storytelling board game for 1-4 players set in the world of the critically acclaimed dice manipulation game, Roll Player. Players take the role of fantasy heroes: facing challenges, adventuring through the realm of Ulos, and making decisions that change the story — and the kingdom — forever.
After a thousand years of peace, Dragul armies raided from the north, prompting you and every other loyal citizen of Nalos to sign up as soldiers of the King’s Guard. The armies of Nalos fought long and hard against the North’s monstrous generals and their minions, finally turning the tide of the Dragul Invasion.
In each of the game's 12 storybooks, you’ll be asked to make choices, complete skill checks, and fight battles that will permanently alter the world of Ulos for that adventure and in future adventures. You’ll find new allies, make enemies, and uncover secrets that will change the world around you.
Whatever choices you make, someone will remember — and respond.
Choose from one of 21 pregenerated characters, or import a favorite Roll Player character and take them on a heroic journey. Each character brings unique attributes, starting cards, class abilities, and backstories to your adventure.
Pregenerated Characters
Importing Characters from Roll Player
Roll Player Adventures does NOT require the Roll Player base game or any of its expansions to play, though it’s possible to import characters generated in Roll Player using any number of its expansions. Do you have a favorite Obnoxious Saurian Fighter who grew up as a Street Urchin from your last game of Roll Player? Bring them along
Each of the 17 races and 36 classes have unique portraits and class abilities in Adventures!
Convert your attribute scores and use them to build dice pools during your adventure!
Every market card from Roll Player has a new dice-manipulating counterpart in Roll Player Adventures!
 Note: Roll Player products will be available individually in the pledge manager.
Roll Player Adventures has 11 adventure books that form a continuous campaign, and 1 infinitely replayable sidequest that can be played at any time. In a session of Roll Player Adventures, you’ll explore a new area of the world of Ulos, represented by a unique adventure map. As your party travels around the map, you’ll read aloud from that adventure’s storybook and choose how you’ll approach each encounter.
During your adventure, you'll encounter strange creatures, solve puzzles and mysteries, and discover new areas of the map to explore.
Roll Player Adventures blends an immersive branching narrative with cooperative skill checks and combat encounters. These dice placement puzzles echo the satisfying, puzzle-solving features of other Thunderworks Games hits such as Roll Player and Cartographers: A Roll Player Tale. In each combat or skill check, players manage their resources to fill dice slots with dice of specific colors and numbers. With clever play and the players can attempt to overcome the obstacles on the path of adventure.

Spend stamina from your character’s attributes to add specific colors of dice to the dice pool: 
Then play cards from your hand to manipulate the dice and solve the puzzle:
If you lose a combat or fail a skill check, there’s no replaying a scenario or rolling up new characters. You now need to deal with the consequences of your failure, and see how the world changes in response. Even death is a new adventure — with its own 10-encounter storyline.
Roll Player Adventures has several systems dedicated to remembering the results of your actions. Together, they represent an incredible amount of responsiveness from the game world to player choices. Importantly, these systems also can interact with each other, giving nuance to relationships — you may choose to gain a temporary ally in an adventure, but be regarded by them differently because you’ve offended their faction in the past.
At the end of each adventure, you’ll spend your earned gold and experience points to advance your characters, improving your party for the next adventure. There are 100's of unique abilities to discover and many ways to specialize.
Want to try Roll Player Adventures for yourself? You can play through a draft of Adventure 1: Battle at Blacklake on both Tabletopia (Free!) and Tabletop Simulator. 
 Rahdo Runs Through - Runthrough
The Nefras's Judgement expansion is available as part of the Immortal Knight and World of Ulos pledge levels. In this expansion, Nefras, the Snake of Years, will judge each character in your party as they make personal choices that are woven through the storyline of your campaign. Uncover your backstory and choose your alignment in Roll Player Adventures: Nefras’s Judgement.
During a campaign including Nefras's Judgement, each character in your party plays through one unique backstory quest that spans across multiple adventure books.
For example, if a character in your party had a “Detective” Backstory, you might slowly uncover clues about a murder, scattered through the adventures in the main campaign, finally either solving the mystery or sending an innocent insectoid to Kulbak prison in the storyline's climax.
When setting up the Nefras’s Judgement expansion at the start of a Roll Player Adventures campaign, players can use the backstory provided with a pregenerated character, or they can import the backstory and alignment from a character built using Roll Player.
As with previous projects, we'll be shipping all pledge levels from reputable fulfillment partners around the world. This project is EU, UK, CA, and AU friendly. This means that rewards bound to those regions ship from within their respective regions so backers in those regions will not pay any VAT, customs, or duties on their games upon arrival at their address. Outside of these areas, we cannot guarantee friendly shipping.

Shipping will be charged in the pledge manager at the conclusion of this Kickstarter project based on pledge level and region. If you add additional items in the pledge manager, this may increase your shipping cost. We're offering a $10+ shipping subsidy to all backers from our actual shipping and VAT charges. See the chart below for estimated shipping costs based on region and pledge. 
Roll Player is a dice drafting, character creation game that has inspired an entire line of titles including two expansions to the core game and two additional games in the world of Ulos -- Cartographers & Lockup. Here's how you play!
The Thunderworks team has been working on this project for over three years. The scope is bigger and more ambitious than any project we've done in the past. It's a project born out of love for both narrative adventure games and the passion players have for the other games in the line. We are excited to bring such a big game to you from a small team.
But, printing a board game with a scope this large is expensive, and Thunderworks Games is a small company. Without the help of backers on Kickstarter, Roll Player Adventures simply will not exist.
We need your support to make this game a reality. The design is complete. The art is complete. Now, all we need is enough people who believe Roll Player Adventures is as cool and fun as we do to join us and make this game a reality!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every project has risks. I've outlined some common areas of risk in boardgame projects and how I've done my best to address them.

> Artwork: All the artwork for the game is complete, with the exception of any images added due to achieving stretch goals or any last minute tweaks before sending the final files off to the manufacturer.

>Development: All twelve books of Roll Player Adventures are complete and have been extensively playtested. We are currently playtesting the full campaign with final art and most of its graphic design to make sure everything is just right before we send the game into final layout for manufacturing.

> Component Quality: I've worked with and built a great relationship with one of the best game manufacturers around, Panda Game Manufacturing (www.pandagm.com). Their proven track record on games like Eclipse, Terra Mystica, Pandemic, Belfort, and Mice & Mystics, proves they make great games with a high standard to quality. They've printed all Thunderworks titles to date.

> Delivery Timeline: Unexpected delays out of my control can always occur (i.e. component shortage, manufacturer issues, customs delays, etc...). For the production schedule of Roll Player Adventures, I've used conservative estimates to account for unknowns and bumps in the road.

> Fulfillment: I have received multiple estimates and will be working with established fulfillment companies that have proven track records for delivering quickly and efficiently all over the world.

> Eighth Project: Even though this is my eighth Kickstarter project, I have continued to spend endless hours researching Kickstarter as well as participating in many Kickstarters. I have done my best to foresee and minimize any obstacles or stumbling blocks.

In addition, in my life outside of this campaign, I have over a decade of project management experience on large-scale software projects. I will continue to leverage that experience and apply it to this project by anticipating issues and sidestepping hurdles that may arise.

campaign.story:
Castle Panic Deluxe is an upgraded version of Castle Panic. It's still the same great mechanics you've loved for over 10 years, now in a special, limited edition that includes all new art, plastic Walls and Towers for the Castle, plastic Monster minis that feature a unique spinning base to track damage, wooden Monster tokens, and more!
Castle Panic is a cooperative game for 1 to 6 players where everyone is working together to defend the castle from monsters coming in from the forest. The players must make it through all 49 Monster tokens and have at least 1 tower still standing in order to win the game. If the monsters destroy all 6 towers, the game ends and the monsters win.
 Castle Panic Deluxe takes everything you love about the standard version of Castle Panic and makes it, well, deluxe! 
All minis figures come assembled but will need their damage bases attached. Don't worry, this is a snap! All plastics will come unpainted, ready for your painterly goodness! 
*Note: All images not final and not to scale. All components and upgrades subject to change.
This pledge level is only available to verified game stores. Verification will require detailed store information including EIN number. The verification process will be at the discretion of Fireside Games and the results will be final. When the campaign ends, you will have access to our pledge manager, where your pledge will be applied as a credit towards your order. Orders will be at a 50% discount and must be in case quantities (3 games per case). Your final order and payment will be determined when the game is ready to ship. Retail orders will be shipped at the same time as all other Kickstarter orders.
Shipping to be charged after the end of the campaign.
Please contact sales@firesidegames.com for more information. 
NOTE: The standard versions of the expansions will also be available as add-ons.
After the campaign ends, we will be using BackerKit as our pledge manager which works like an online store where the amount you pledged is available as credit for you to spend as you wish. This is where you will provide your shipping information and can choose to add any additional products to your pledge.
There are 2 ways to pay for additional items. You can add products in the pledge manager after the campaign has ended and pay for the difference at that time, or you can pledge more during the campaign and spend that however you want in the pledge manager. Keep in mind, when you pledge more during the campaign, it helps unlock stretch goals!
 This game will be printed in enough volume to fulfill the Kickstarter plus a small amount to cover damages and other issues. We reserve the right to sell any remaining inventory on our website, at conventions, and 3rd party sites if necessary.
 In 2009, we launched our first game Castle Panic, a cooperative, tower defense board game. Over 10 years and hundreds of thousands of copies later, we're thrilled to bring you the ultimate edition of this evergreen family game.
The costs listed above are estimates only but are based on current pricing from our fulfillment partners using an estimated weight.  Actual shipping costs will be charged via our pledge manager.
Due to complications with customs and regulations, we will not be shipping to Russia, Ukraine, Kazakhstan, and Afghanistan.
Fireside Games was started in 2007 by Justin and Anne-Marie De Witt. We decided to take our hobby of creating board games to play with our friends and turn it into a business. In 2009, Castle Panic became the first game we published and since then we've grown our catalog and published 18 other games. We founded Fireside Games with the core goal of creating fun, innovative, accessible board games that everyone can enjoy, and based on our growing fanbase, we're proud to say it's working.
We are committed to bringing joy and shared experiences to life through board games. We love hearing from people all over the world about how our games help them reconnect with friends and family, even in this hectic world. We’re proud of the experiences we create, and we are thrilled when we can help you to bring fun home!
Caste Panic Deluxe is a big project and a complex, expensive game. We've been selling games to Friendly Local Game Stores for over a decade, and we've seen the ups and downs of the 3-tier system (publisher, distribution, retail). We're in a challenging time right now, and selling games like this can be difficult to get right. Because this game is so costly to manufacture, there is a lot more risk if we were to publish this game through traditional means. A wrong guess on inventory could be devastating to a company of our size. We know that there are a lot of fans who have loved Castle Panic from the beginning, and we know that there will be new fans that are going to fall in love with this new version. The best way we can get a product of this scale into the hands of players who are excited to have it is to work directly with our customers via the Kickstarter platform.
                                         This project is promoted by Green Inbox
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Fireside Games has been publishing and distributing games around the world for over 10 years. During that time, we have worked with multiple factories and international freight companies to ensure our high-quality games are delivered on-time and in excellent condition. For this Kickstarter, we are working with experienced partners like Quartermaster Logistics to continue that pattern of quality.

We are estimating an April 2021 delivery date for this game, but please keep in mind this is only an estimate. There are always elements beyond our control when working with manufacturers, such as virus outbreaks, production delays, shipping delays, and delays with customs. Should these occur, we will make sure that we quickly communicate any delay or challenge and keep our backers updated.

In addition, the game has already gone through substantial production, which further limits chances for delays. The artwork is mostly complete, the plastics have been sculpted, and many components are at or near a print-ready state. Final layout, proofing, and editing still need to be done, but we are confident in our timing estimates.

REFUNDS
If you request a refund within 14 days of the end of the campaign, we can refund your pledge including fees. Refunds processed after 14 days will still be credited, minus Kickstarter and payment processing fees, which we are not reimbursed for at that time. Refunds processed after 14 days may be refunded via PayPal or Stripe to the card used at our discretion.

This project is funded in USD and any refunds will also be processed in USD.

All artwork and materials shown are not final and are subject to change.

campaign.story:
The coolest game to ever hit the planet first appeared some 38 years ago, featuring an electronic tower that lit up, played music, and somehow ran an epic fantasy adventure game with its state-of-the-art technological wizardry. That game was Dark Tower. We want to bring you that same sense of awe and wonder, pushing the boundaries of what a board game can actually do. After 3 years of painstaking work by a team of two dozen designers, engineers, and artists, we are thrilled to present to you a game with echoes of that long-gone wonder but ultimately unlike any game you've ever experienced.
Return to Dark Tower is a game for 1 to 4 heroes who undertake epic quests, fight fearsome foes, and test their mettle against the looming darkness of the titular tower. Now featuring both cooperative and competitive play. Designed by Rob Daviau and Isaac Childres -- designers of the two highest rated games of all time on Board Game Geek -- along with Noah Cohen, Brian Neff, and Justin D. Jacobson, the streamlined rules offer players difficult choices about when to advance their objective, gather resources, deal with threats, or level up.
Each player controls a unique hero with their own starting inventory and special abilities. Along the way you gain helpful items, powerful virtues, and trusty companions to help you achieve your goal: Find a way into the Tower and defeat a powerful adversary.
Figuring out the best way to utilize all of these assets is the key to victory. The game actively works to stop you, responding to your decisions and taking advantage of your missteps. Foes, each with their own strengths and weaknesses, will stalk your hero and assault your buildings.
Our innovative combat system leverages the power of the processor. Within the app, select virtual "cards" from each foe's unique deck, revealing the potential consequences of the fight. Then, use your hero's advantages to modify those results. Will you mitigate losses across the board, or focus on one to gain valuable resources for your effort.
Looming over the board, the Tower itself is the greatest menace you'll face. Each turn, you drop a skull in, representing the threat of corruption. You decide where emerging skulls are placed, making those buildings less useful. At times the Tower itself springs to life, releasing trapped skulls in a single wave or revealing glyphs that sap your will.
The path to victory is fraught with peril. Battles and events can give your hero corruption. If you don't cleanse skulls from the buildings to keep them in check, the supply quickly dwindles.  
Tarry too long and face the risk of having all of the seals of the Tower break. Corruption, skulls, and time: Any one of these pitfalls can spell defeat.
Return to Dark Tower constantly presents new challenges. The adversary within the tower, the plan to access the tower, and the suite of foes you will face can mix and match in thousands of combinations. Play the same array over again or try something completely new.
For complete information on how to play, you can download the draft rulebook: 
Or check out this live playthrough we'll be doing on the Dice Tower:
We've also arranged for a how-to-play video by Rodney Smith of Watch It Played! at the time of release. 
Created by a world-class team of designers and engineers led by Tim Burrell-Saward, an expert in technology-augmented games, the Tower itself is a game component without equal. From its very foundation, it's been devised to play an integral role in the game. Using a collection of magical-yet-reliable technologies, it generates game moments that simply wouldn't be possible without it. The Tower literally and figuratively dominates the table, drawing upon all of these powers to foil you. You will grow to curse its name.
Learn more about the intense tower development and prototyping process in Tim's designer diary.
The game itself is rich and satisfying. But we have a few additional items in this campaign to upgrade your play experience even further.
For those of you new to Kickstarter, an "add-on" is something that's not included with a regular pledge. If you're interested in getting the neoprene board or any other add-on we might add to the campaign, it's really simple. You have two options:
You can manually add the amount of the add-on to your existing pledge. (For the mat, it's $45 including shipping.) If you have already backed and you go to the top of the campaign page, you'll see a button in the top right that says "Manage your pledge". Click on it and it will take to you a "Change your pledge". Then you can click on the "Change your pledge" button. Then, in the box with your "Pledge amount" you can manually add the cost of the add-on to your pledge. Click "Continue" and your good to go. (NOTE: You can also use this method if you want to upgrade from the Charge the Tower to the Azkol's Fortune level.)
You can add any add-ons in BackerKit (our pledge manager) after the Kickstarter campaign is over. I'll talk more about how pledge managers work as we get closer to the end of the campaign, but it might help to think of it as an online store where you "spend" the money you pledged in the Kickstarter campaign and where you can add new items too, like the neoprene board.
The Alliances expansion offers new rules and components to add further depth and variety to the game. It includes two new heroes, who can be used in any game. The Archwright fortifies buildings to protect the kingdoms; the Haunted Recluse dabbles in forbidden lore to powerful effect. Influence is a new resource that can be used to form alliances with powerful guilds or to thwart the capricious whims of the nobles. It also features new treasures and allies with more intricate abilities for experienced gamers.
The Dark Horde box contains stunning sculpts by Punga Miniatures of all the foes in the game. These figures bring the foes to life. (Keep checking back here as we unlock new foes and show off new sculpts.)
 The Coffers box replaces the cardboard resource tokens from the game and the Alliances expansion with top-quality, heat-transfer plastic tokens that have a great feel and durability.
 This 50mm diameter and 5mm thick metal coin signifies the active player. If you signed up for notification before the campaign launched, you will receive this for free if you back the kickstarter and get at least one copy of the game.
Seriously, folks. This mat is huge and heavy. It's about 80% larger area than the game board. This makes the spaces larger as well of course, which can be a boon if you're playing with the miniature foes from Dark Horde. A real specialty item for those who want to play an epic game on an epic stage.
 Check out this rendered example of a gold foil art print:
Give all your cards a little extra protection. This add on includes enough high-quality sleeves to cover the cards in Return to Dark Tower and the Alliances expansion. 110 standard card sleeves and 85 mini sleeves (plus some extras for lost or broken sleeves). Most sleeves will have a custom print, but some standard sized sleeves will be completely clear to accommodate the double-sided cards.



Part of the fun of Kickstarter is achieving new heights and unlocking those sweet stretch goals. We've already packed a ton of content into the game, but we'll manage to find a way to get even more goodies in there. So let's break those seals!

At PAX Unplugged, we were able to run a number of tabletop media folks through the game. These opinions were freely given and provided without compensation. Here's what they had to say:
We know you'll love Return to Dark Tower. But you might be wondering why you should back now. There are four main reasons:
 You can get what you want. The game itself is not exclusive to Kickstarter. We do have a retailer pledge in the campaign, so there are stores who will have the game when it fulfills. However, we are still unsure if we will be able to sell the game into retail distribution, and the add-ons are particularly unlikely to be available widely if at all. Backing is the one way to make sure you get what you want.
 You'll get the game early. Even if the game does ultimately go into retail distribution, we promise to hold the retail street date for at least 90 days after fulfillment is completed. As a thank you for backing, we want to make sure our backers get the first chance to play.
 You'll get the game cheaper. As you can see above, you will pledge less than the suggested retail price. While it is true that some online retailers often sell games for below the regular price, that's less likely in this case. If the game ends up not going into retail distribution, aggressive discount merchants won't have access to it. Even if it does, the discount is likely not be much better than what we're offering in the campaign.
 You get to be a backer. Being a backer means being part of a community. You'll get to speak up on decisions we make during the campaign and share ideas with other backers. Most importantly, you'll help make this game become a reality. Some publishers have taken to using Kickstarter as a pre-order system. That is very much not the case with Return to Dark Tower. We simply could not make the game without the success of this campaign. You'll be a part of that success and part of unlocking stretch goals to make the game even better.
If this is your first Kickstarter, welcome! It's easier than it looks, and being a part of the community can be a lot of fun! You can download this PDF file to learn the ins-and-outs of being a backer:

We are once again using Quartermaster Logistics to oversee the fulfillment process. They have an extremely efficient system, quality packaging, tracking information, and their customer service is second to none. We have key fulfillment partners within each shipping region and will freight the games directly to them, so there will be no surprise charges, such as customs fees or VAT, to the US, EU, Canada, Australia, and China.
Please use the chart below to calculate your shipping fees. Due to an error in setting up the Kickstarter page, some countries are charged at the time of pledge, while others will be charged in the pledge manager after the campaign. You will also be charged additional shipping if you order add-ons or multiple copies and at similar rates.


We cannot ship to PO Boxes or to the following countries: Afghanistan, Burma (Myanmar), Cuba, Iran, Kazakhstan, North Korea, Russia, Sudan, Syria, and Ukraine.
We are also thrilled to be using BackerKit again. They are a "pledge manager", a third-party service that lets us manage our orders and fulfillment. This service starts after the Kickstarter campaign is over. You'll be able to add items to your pledge at that time. If you are unsure about what items you want to get during the Kickstarter campaign, you can back at the "Map to BackerKit" level. This will qualify you as a backer for any backer-related goodies and will give you access to the pledge manager to fill out your order later.
RETAILERS
We have a special pledge tier for verified brick-and-mortar stores: For Bazaar Proprietors Only. You pledge only $50 during the campaign. In the pledge manager, you will finalize your order. However, you will not have to pay the remaining balance due until the games are ready to ship. Please click here for detailed information and terms.

Restoration Games was founded in 2016 by Justin D. Jacobson and Rob Daviau on a shared love of all those great board games they played when they were kids. We are dedicated to restoring these games to their rightful glory,  bringing the fun we had to a new generation of gamers.
SPREAD THE WORD
A Kickstarter campaign is only as strong as its backers. You will help push this project to be the best it can be. We greatly appreciate anything you can do to let people know about this campaign, whether it's posting to your social media accounts, sending emails to your friends, or letting a co-worker know about us.
If you haven't joined the game's facebook group, go do it. We've got a great group of fans, talking about the game, and it's a good place to go to ask questions.

updates.update_userinfo: Titanic Update: Revised Fulfillment Timeline and a Bunch of Other Stuff
updates.update_content:
Lots and lots of stuff to talk about. Everything is picking up the pace as we finalize manufacturing. To keep this update from getting too long, I'm going to update you all on the fulfillment timeline and then do some quick hits about a number of other things. Let's get to it!
Fulfillment Timeline

updates.update_userinfo: Guest Update: An APP-etizer with Tim Burrell-Saward (and Live Playthrough Next Week!)
updates.update_content: One critical part of the game we haven't shown much of is the companion app. In fact, our app developer, Porcelain Fortress, headed by the inimitable Björn Elíeser Jónsson, has been working non-stop for more than two years on it. And we're finally ready for you all to have an early look. I tapped Tim Burrell-Saward, our project manager and lead engineer, to do a deep dive on the app's heroic journey to date. As with all of these updates, keep in mind that we are still refining and will continue to refine until the game gets into your hands and beyond. Everything here is still "in progress". Specifically, a lot of the text has not even had an editing pass. Let me make this extra-clear:

updates.update_userinfo: Final Engineering Prototype and Detailed Plastic Photos
updates.update_content:
As some of you might have seen, the team received a slew of FEPs this past week. "FEP" stands for "final engineering prototype". Sometimes also referred to as a "mass-production copy", it's the first full "game" comprising all of the final files intended to be used for mass production. It's one last check to find any last little problem before we hit the big red button that says: spend a million dollars and make 25,000 copies of this game.
I have to say, it's an extremely rewarding milestone. This is a project that I've been working on for three years. To open a box and see an actual playable game, is pretty amazing. But it's also a bit tense. It's a major checkpoint, where you're likely to run into issues that need addressing. You're just hoping that they're all manageable.

updates.update_userinfo: Call for Playtesters and a Look at the Hero Minis
updates.update_content:
We continue to make steady progress in the production process. All of the print materials have been locked down. Plastic production by Panda is underway. I've got a sweet photo of those hero minis for you in a minute.
But first, I'm putting out a call for playtesters. With the print materials locked down, we're looking to refine the data in the app to further balance the game and make it more fun. These playtests will be done in Tabletop Simulator (on Steam) and (unlike prior playtests) will use the actual app (with a built-in Tower simulator). We know some of you signed up for and did some playtesting for us last year. But circumstances can change -- especially during current events these days. So, even if you signed up before, if you're still interested in testing, please sign up again. To playtest, you will need access to Tabletop Simulator and an Android or iOS device to run the app. You would be able to playtest remotely, but it would be easier if you have a group that can get together in person to share the app device.

updates.update_userinfo: * IMPORTANT: Mobile Devices Survey - PLEASE FILL OUT *
updates.update_content: Listen, some updates are less exciting than others. Although I don't have anything sexy to show off, this is a very important update. The app infrastructure is nearly built. We'll then be moving into testing (and data editing). It would be extremely helpful to know what devices you all are planning on using to play the final game. This will help us make sure that the final version of the app is thoroughly tested for those devices. We'll have a deep dive update on the app with lots of gorgeous screen shots, but in the mean time, please go to this link, preferably with your device in hand, and complete this very brief, 4-question survey: MOBILE DEVICES SURVEY LINK

As I've mentioned, I'm planning on doing more, shorter updates on a regular basis, punctuated by longer, more in-depth updates when something important happens. Today, I've got a quickie.
As you know, we are in the very final stages of the Tower engineering before we sign off and manufacturing begins. Even then, they'll need to test the Towers to make sure they're working. That's easy for the other components: are the cards printed correctly, do the minis look good, etc. But how do you test an electronic Tower?

In this update, I'm going to show off the insert for the game (with a good look at the current state of the box as well). Basically, an unboxing in jpgs instead of video. It's a lot like an onion: multiple layers, and it'll make you cry (cause it's so beautiful). At the end of the update, I'll bring everyone up to speed on the general state of the project and where we are with various other parts of the game. So, if inserts don't tickle your toes, you can jump straight to the end.
Before we get into it, the usual caveats: This is 99% final, but that means it's 1% not final, which basically means things can still change. Not likely but possible. This goes doubly for the box render and the stuff rendered in the insert, like the punchboard and rules and such. Without further ado, let's start at the top.

updates.update_userinfo: A Closer Look at the Competitive Game
updates.update_content: For this update, I'll be showing off a bit more of the competitive game. As most of you know, the original game from 1982 was a competitive game. Players raced to defeat the brigands in the Tower. The first one to do it won the game. Early on in our development, we decided to make our restored version cooperative. We think it's more thematic appropriately and mechanically. But we knew some folks would like to be able to play competitively like in the original. We continued to work on it even as we entered the Kickstarter and finally announced we were doing it way back in Update #11.

updates.update_userinfo: Let's Check Out the Box Bottom
updates.update_content:
As we move into this next stage of production, my plan is to post smaller, more regular updates and start showing off some stuff you all haven't seen or that has been updated since the campaign. Today, we're going to take a quick look at the box bottom.
First thing to mention is that it's not really the box bottom at all. The box will, of course, have a bottom, but this ain't it. Bigger picture, we know that you all have paid a lot of money to get this game. Granted, most of the expense is in that beautiful electronic Tower that will sit in the middle of the table. But we want to make sure the rest of the game meets that high bar. Traditionally, a box bottom serves as a marketing piece to attract the eye of someone browsing at the store, and it also has a number of legal requirements, like safety icons and copyright notices. Fine and necessary, but not pretty to look at. So we made the decision to have the traditional box bottom turn into a separate slip sheet that is placed over the box bottom and held into place by the shrinkwrap. When you open the shrink, you can toss the sheet. This meets our needs for the store shelf, but allows you to have a beautiful game box on your shelf at home.

updates.update_userinfo: Guest Update: Checking in on the Tower with Tim Burrell-Saward
updates.update_content:
I know folks like to get a closer look at the manufacturing process, and there's no one better to fill us in than Tim Burrell-Saward, our project manager and lead engineer.
Before we jump in, Board Game Geek's annual "Most Anticipated" list is underway. Nominations are open for games you're looking forward to this year. If you're willing and able, we'd appreciate your support for our nomination. All you have to do is click here and click the green thumb under the box cover. Thanks!

 “Foundations of Rome is an amazing design that I've had the pleasure of watching come into being over the last few years.  Emerson has once again taken simplicity and greatness and combined the two into an extremely entertaining tactical city building game.” - Tom Vasel (The Dice Tower)
"It's as elegant and fun as every other Emerson game has been. Everyone picked it up quickly and the competition was fierce! This one is going to hit the table often!" - Bebo (Be Bold Games)

campaign.story:
The first car combat game, and still the best . . . Car Wars returns in a bigger, faster edition. The detailed 1/64 scale cars move, shoot, and catch fire the way you remember, with faster car creation and play. Once again you can rule the roads!
NOTE: All miniatures are pre-assembled at the factory and packed unpainted. Miniatures shown in the photos are prototypes. Miniatures painted by Ben Williams. 
Foreground: Warhawk, one of the six miniatures included in the Car Wars Sixth Edition core game. Miniatures painted by Ben Williams. Displayed on Car Wars Playmat #1. All work shown is in progress and not final.
North America, A.D. 2070. It's a new American frontier. The collapse of the U.S. government plunged the country back into the good old days -- days of wilderness lawlessness, banditry, regional dictators, and of the men and women who combat them. Modern-day knights and gunslingers are in demand; but the automobile has replaced the horse, and the machine-gun and recoilless rifle have made the sword and Winchester obsolete.
Welcome to 2070. It's a rough world, but it's the only one around . . . 
Car Wars is the game of autoduelling; futuristic vehicular combat where the right of way goes to the biggest guns. Players design their cars -- complete with weapons, accessories, and crew -- and then take them into the arena where one emerges victorious . . . and the others are annihilated.
First published in 1981, the earlier editions of Car Wars have sold over one million games and accessories during the game's near-four decades of life. Over the years, the Car Wars game -- as well as the world of Autoduel America -- has grown, adding more rules, expansions, and setting information. Car Wars has been featured in comic books, novels, solo adventure gamebooks, and even the fan-favorite classic Autoduel video game. 
Now, with your support, we're bringing Car Wars back as a faster, streamlined edition with detailed plastic models. The new Car Wars game was designed to put you in the driver's seat and into the action within moments of opening the game box.
After six years of design, development, playtesting, and constant refinement and improvement, we've completed the core of the new Car Wars Sixth Edition game and we're now ready for your support. 
The new core game includes:
24-page rulebook, covering everything from building your car to movement and combat. All of the rules you need to start playing the game within moments of opening the box! 
TEN (stretch goal unlocked!) 1/64 scale highly-detailed plastic car models. Pre-assembled at the factory, these miniatures are ready to paint and take into the arena. Or, for those of you who want to jump into the action quickly, use the minis unpainted; the included car bases are color-coded so that you can instantly tell which car is yours during the heat of battle. 
Four color-coded player dashboards. These thick, durable chipboard player boards include spaces for your car's external armor, tire points, power plant points, as well as your car's current speed.
Four car design decks, one for each of the included player colors. Using the Build Point and Crew Point mechanics, you can create a new car (and outfit your driver and gunner) in less than ten minutes! 
Two different internal damage card decks, one for low-point value games and one for high-point value games. Once armor is penetrated, a card is randomly drawn to determine which internal components are hit by an attack.
Twenty custom six-sided dice! These are used for all attack rolls, defensive rolls, and movement rolls in the game. 
A chipboard turning key. Use this when moving and maneuvering your car. The turning key works perfectly with the color-coded car bases; your car pivots over the turning key so that every swerve and turn made during the game is as accurate as possible. (Includes two copies of the key.)
Dozens of damage, control, Ace, and other types of tokens that are required to track the status of various parts of the game. 
A streamlined collision system that keeps the game flowing. See how the bases are used to push objects in a collision in this Facebook video. 
Play on any smooth tabletop . . . or upgrade your game with one of the Car Wars playmats (see Add-Ons, below). The basic arena is a 36" x 36" playspace; scenarios expand play to even larger spaces for those of you who want to play a highway game, fight in a big arena, or tackle a custom scenario of your own design.
Do you want to see Car Wars Sixth Edition in action? Check out these gameplay videos for an overview of the game's movement and combat systems in action. More videos to come between now and the close of the Kickstarter campaign on January 6, 2020!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Steve Jackson Games is an established game publisher with a successful track record and we have enough Kickstarter experience to deal with issues should they arise. 

Car Wars Sixth Edition is our largest project of 2020. This campaign is set to close on January 6, 2020, and -- if successful -- will lead to many months of work as our team completes the game and expansions and prepares everything for manufacturing.

We have completed a lot of the necessary work for the game already, but project stretch goals may greatly expand on the number of tasks we must finish before the game is ready for manufacturing. We're doing what we can to stay ahead of any stretch goals, but when it comes to creative efforts, there are times when some stages require more attention and refinement than we may first expect. We're doing all we can to deliver the project on schedule, but we also admit that there are sometimes issues that lead to delays.

As we've done in the past, we will stay in touch with our backers during and after the Kickstarter, all the way through fulfillment of the rewards.

updates.update_content:
At the moment, we've approved many of the game and expansion packs. The assembly stage continues, but we can see a light at the end of the tunnel. We do not yet have a completion date, but we are getting very close. News to come.
For now, new pics that Sabrina shot today in the office!
- Phil Reed

Today, I'm visiting the GPI offices and reviewing the Car Wars project.  The game is still in the assembly stage, and we are now watching assembly videos from the factory.
While we continue spending the day going over Car Wars, here are a few quick pics I snapped. We should be able to share the assembly videos, probably next week.
- Phil Reed

As of today, the project is moving into the final stages of manufacturing and is expected to shift into the assembly stage ASAP. The factory continues to keep everything moving forward and we should have more news in a week or two. If all goes well, we'll also start to see the 100% completed production samples before the end of the month.
- Phil Reed

Everything is still in manufacturing and expected to move into assembly next month. We'll share when we have more news, but for now here's a video that was sent to us showing all of the final test shots* of the minis as the factory moves these into final manufacturing. Reportedly, lots of paper, chipboard, and cardboard have already been turning into Car Wars boxes, rules, etc. Things are racing along!
- Phil Reed

We've got some new pics from the factory this morning, this time showing how the three box sets in the core game look with many of their goodies. We're not yet at the finish line, but things are starting to come together as the factory works through manufacturing all of the necessary components.
- Phil Reed

Now that the new year is behind us and we're in the manufacturing stage, we have a little more info on when everything is expected to complete production. By mid-May, we should be in the assembly stage of the project. This is when all of the plastics, paper, chipboard, and cardstock components are complete and the factory puts together the finished games and expansions.
Between now and then, we'll receive very little in the way of new information.  During manufacturing, the factory (multiple factories, if we want to get technical) makes all of the stuff. If it were a normal year, I would join a few of our partners at GPI for a trip to the primary assembly factory for a look at everything. Unfortunately, this is not a normal year.

updates.update_userinfo: Multiple PDFs Released as BackerKit Digital Downloads
